contentrichtext.text: '''Amariah''' {{lang-he|אֲמַרְיָה}} means "promised by God" in [[Hebrew language|Hebrew]]. <!--I think--> It was commonly used as a name of priests in the [[History of ancient Israel and Judah]]. It appear several times in the [[Hebrew Bible]]: #One of the descendants of [[Aaron]] by [[Eleazar]] (1 Chr. 6:7,52). He was probably the last of the high priests of [[Eleazar]]'s line prior to the transfer of that office to Eli, of the line of Ithamar. #A Levite, son of Hebron, of the lineage of [[Moses]] (1 Chr. 23:19; 24:23). #A "chief priest" who took an active part in the reformation under [[Jehoshaphat]] (2 Chr. 19:11); probably the same as mentioned in 1 Chr. 6:9. #1 Chr. 6:11; [[Ezra]] 7:3. #One of the high priests in the time of [[Hezekiah]] (2 Chr. 31:15). #Zeph. 1:1. #Neh. 11:4. #Neh. 10:3. #[[Ezra]] 10:42. {{eastons}} {{Tanakh-stub}} [[Category:Hebrew Bible people]]
